tit.cmt: 用語集はoguchiですが、本文に表記を合わせました

sen.j: 大口袴（おおくちばかま）とは、束帯装束の表袴の下に履く裾の大きく開いた紅色の肌袴のこと。
sen.e: Okuchi bakama is red-colored wide sleeve hakama which is worn as underwear of the outer hakama for 東帯 costume.
Okuchi bakama is red-colored wide sleeve hakama which is worn as underwear of the outer hakama for sokutai shozoku (traditional ceremonial court dress).
sen.cmt: 東帯ではなく束帯なので、それに沿って修正
sen.e: Okuchi bakama is red-colored wide sleeve hakama which is worn as underwear of the outer hakama for sokutai shozoku (traditional ceremonial court dress).

sen.j: 後世、少年や武家の袴として白や浅葱の大口袴を独立して使うようになったため、正式な肌袴としての大口袴を特に赤大口と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: The authentic okuchi bakama was sometimes called "akaokuchi," to differentiate it from white or pale blue okuchi bakama which was later worn by boys or samurai as outer wear.

sen.j: 本来の大口袴は紅色の平絹を使って仕立てる、足首丈（対丈）四幅（左右二幅ずつ）の切袴である。
sen.e: Okuchi bakama is an ankle-length (called "tuitake," full length of height) kiri-hakama (short fringe hakama) of 144 centimeters wide (72 centimeters for each side) which is tailored with red hiraginu (plain silk.)

sen.j: 袷仕立てだが、普通の衣装のように裏地を別に用意するのではなく表地の余りを折り返して裏地にする「引返しの裏打ち」という処理をする。
sen.e: Although it is a lined garment, the unused part of the outer material is folded back and used as the lining cloth, which is a process called "Hikikaechinourauchi."

sen.j: 腰紐は現代の袴のように前後二本ではなく、「腰一本」と言って腰周りに長い紐を一本縫い付けて左右の端を垂らしたものである。
sen.e: Okuchi bakama has only one long waist cord (called "Koshiippon") sewn on with both ends hanging, while present-day hakama has two waist cords (one in front and another in back).

sen.j: 紐はいったん右腰で交差して、左腰で結ぶ。
sen.e: The waist cord is first crossed at the right hip and then tied at the left hip.

sen.j: 色は紅色が大原則だが、若年者の「濃装束」では紅色の代わりに茜と紫根で染める「濃色」（こきいろ）を用いた。
sen.e: As a rule okuchi bakama is red, but there were "kokiiro (dark color)" okuchi bakama dyed with madder and lithospermum root for "Noshozoku" of young people.

sen.e: High-ranking nobility wore okuchi bakama of reddish yellow (color of a dead and fallen leaf) from age 40 onwards, as the aged.

sen.j: 公家少年の半尻（丈の短い狩衣）装束には、指貫の代用として「前張大口」（さいはりのおおくち）と言う白い大口袴を使用した。
sen.e: For hanjiri (short informal clothes) costume of court noble boys, either white okuchi bakama called "Saiharinookuchi" or sashinuki (a type of hakama, pleated trousers for formal wear) was worn.
